The (real) logarithm of a natural number `n`is bounded by a multiple of every power of `n`
with positive exponent.

type: ∀ (n : ℕ) {ε : ℝ}, 0 < ε → Real.log ↑n ≤ ↑n ^ ε / ε
name: Real.log_natCast_le_rpow_div
docString:
The (real) logarithm of a natural number `n`is bounded by a multiple of every power of `n`
with positive exponent.

For all natural numbers $n$, $1$ is a proper divisor of $n$ if and only if $n$ is a positive integer.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, 1 ∈ n.properDivisors ↔ 1 < n
name: Nat.one_mem_properDivisors_iff_one_lt
docString: For all natural numbers $n$, $1$ is a proper divisor of $n$ if and only if $n$ is a positive integer.

This theorem states that for any integer `n` and any non-zero integer `d`, there exists an integer `c` such that `n` equals `c` times the numerator of the rational number `n/d`, and `d` equals `c` times the denominator of this rational number. In other words, it shows that `n` and `d` can be expressed as multiples of the respective parts of the fraction `n/d`.

name: Rat.exists_eq_mul_div_num_and_eq_mul_div_den
docString: This theorem states that for any integer `n` and any non-zero integer `d`, there exists an integer `c` such that `n` equals `c` times the numerator of the rational number `n/d`, and `d` equals `c` times the denominator of this rational number. In other words, it shows that `n` and `d` can be expressed as multiples of the respective parts of the fraction `n/d`.

Being `C^n` is a local property.

name: contMDiffOn_of_locally_contMDiffOn
docString: Being `C^n` is a local property.

For every natural number $n$, the integer square root of $n^2$ equals $n$. In other words, $\sqrt{n^2} = n$.

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), (n * n).sqrt = n
name: Nat.sqrt_eq
docString: For every natural number $n$, the integer square root of $n^2$ equals $n$. In other words, $\sqrt{n^2} = n$.

This theorem states that for every positive natural number `n`, the value of `n` when coerced to an integer is strictly greater than zero. In other words, when we take any positive natural number and view it as an integer, the result is always a positive integer.

name: PNat.pos
docString: This theorem states that for every positive natural number `n`, the value of `n` when coerced to an integer is strictly greater than zero. In other words, when we take any positive natural number and view it as an integer, the result is always a positive integer.

The constant function with value `n : ℤ`.

type: {α : Type u_1} → ℤ → Poly α
name: Poly.const
docString: The constant function with value `n : ℤ`.

positive integers summing to `n`

type: {n : ℕ} → Nat.Partition n → Multiset ℕ
name: Nat.Partition.parts
docString: positive integers summing to `n`

Infinitely many natural numbers are equal to `d` mod `n`.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, n ≠ 0 → ∀ (d : ℕ), ∃ᶠ (m : ℕ) in Filter.atTop, m ≡ d [MOD n]
name: Nat.frequently_modEq
docString: Infinitely many natural numbers are equal to `d` mod `n`.

A number that divides an `n`-smooth number is itself `n`-smooth.

type: ∀ {n m k : ℕ}, m ∈ Nat.smoothNumbers n → k ∣ m → k ≠ 0 → k ∈ Nat.smoothNumbers n
name: Nat.mem_smoothNumbers_of_dvd
docString: A number that divides an `n`-smooth number is itself `n`-smooth.

A regular element `c` is right-regular

type: ∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : Mul R] {c : R}, IsRegular c → IsRightRegular c
name: IsRegular.right
docString: A regular element `c` is right-regular

If a function is `C^n` with `n ≥ 1`, then it is differentiable.

name: ContDiff.differentiable
docString: If a function is `C^n` with `n ≥ 1`, then it is differentiable.

If there is a primitive `n`-th root of unity in `K`, then `cyclotomic' n K` comes from a
monic polynomial with integer coefficients.

type:
∀ {K : Type u_2} [inst : CommRing K] [inst_1 : IsDomain K] {ζ : K} {n : ℕ},
  IsPrimitiveRoot ζ n →
    ∃ P,
      Polynomial.map (Int.castRingHom K) P = Polynomial.cyclotomic' n K ∧
        Polynomial.degree P = Polynomial.degree (Polynomial.cyclotomic' n K) ∧ Polynomial.Monic P
name: Polynomial.int_coeff_of_cyclotomic'
docString:
If there is a primitive `n`-th root of unity in `K`, then `cyclotomic' n K` comes from a
monic polynomial with integer coefficients.

`n₀` is always `> 0`

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Fintype α] {T : ℕ → ℝ} {g : ℝ → ℝ} {a b : α → ℝ} {r : α → ℕ → ℕ}
  (self : AkraBazziRecurrence T g a b r), 0 < self.n₀
name: AkraBazziRecurrence.n₀_gt_zero
docString: `n₀` is always `> 0`

Nonnegative real numbers.

type: Type
name: NNReal
docString: Nonnegative real numbers.

For a real `r > 1` we have `n = o(r ^ n)` as `n → ∞`.

type: ∀ {R : Type u_4} [inst : NormedRing R] {r : ℝ}, 1 < r → Nat.cast =o[Filter.atTop] fun n => r ^ n
name: isLittleO_coe_const_pow_of_one_lt
docString: For a real `r > 1` we have `n = o(r ^ n)` as `n → ∞`.

Multiplication by `n` is a polynomial function.

type: ∀ (p : ℕ) [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)] (n : ℕ), WittVector.IsPoly p fun R _Rcr x => x * ↑n
name: WittVector.mulN_isPoly
docString: Multiplication by `n` is a polynomial function.

`x^n`, `n : ℕ` is convex on the whole real line whenever `n` is even.

type: ∀ {𝕜 : Type u_1} [inst : LinearOrderedCommRing 𝕜] {n : ℕ}, Even n → ConvexOn 𝕜 Set.univ fun x => x ^ n
name: Even.convexOn_pow
docString: `x^n`, `n : ℕ` is convex on the whole real line whenever `n` is even.

An algebraic integer whose conjugates are all of norm one is a root of unity.

type:
∀ (K : Type u_1) [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : NumberField K] (A : Type u_2) [inst_2 : NormedField A]
  [inst_3 : IsAlgClosed A] [inst_4 : NormedAlgebra ℚ A] {x : K},
  IsIntegral ℤ x → (∀ (φ : K →+* A), ‖φ x‖ = 1) → ∃ n, ∃ (_ : 0 < n), x ^ n = 1
name: NumberField.Embeddings.pow_eq_one_of_norm_eq_one
docString: An algebraic integer whose conjugates are all of norm one is a root of unity.

If a function is `C^n` around each point in a set, then it is `C^n` on the set.

name: contDiffOn_of_locally_contDiffOn
docString: If a function is `C^n` around each point in a set, then it is `C^n` on the set.

For `a ≤ b`, there is a `c` so `b = a * c`.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} [self : CanonicallyOrderedCommMonoid α] {a b : α}, a ≤ b → ∃ c, b = a * c
name: CanonicallyOrderedCommMonoid.exists_mul_of_le
docString: For `a ≤ b`, there is a `c` so `b = a * c`.

If a function is `C^n` with `n ≥ 1` at a point, then it is differentiable there.

name: ContDiffAt.differentiableAt
docString: If a function is `C^n` with `n ≥ 1` at a point, then it is differentiable there.

If `x^n`, `n > 0`, is integer and is not the `n`-th power of an integer, then
`x` is irrational.

type: ∀ {x : ℝ} (n : ℕ) (m : ℤ), x ^ n = ↑m → (¬∃ y, x = ↑y) → 0 < n → Irrational x
name: irrational_nrt_of_notint_nrt
docString:
If `x^n`, `n > 0`, is integer and is not the `n`-th power of an integer, then
`x` is irrational.

List of positive integers summing to `n`

type: {n : ℕ} → Composition n → List ℕ
name: Composition.blocks
docString: List of positive integers summing to `n`
